intro: Stylidium willingii, commonly known as the purple-veined sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble small sunflowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are predominantly yellow with purple veins, and it produces small, round seed pods after blooming. Stylidium willingii is a rare and protected species, often found in specific habitats along the northern coast of Queensland.
